name: spatialvi-spatial-transcriptomics
title: nf-core/spatialvi - Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis
description: Bioinformatics analysis pipeline for processing spatially-resolved gene counts from 10x Genomics Visium transcriptomics data with spatial coordinates and image data
content:
nf-core/spatialvi: Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis Pipeline

Pipeline Overview: A comprehensive bioinformatics pipeline for processing and analyzing 10x Genomics Visium spatial transcriptomics data. The pipeline can process raw data directly using Space Ranger or analyze data already processed by Space Ranger.

Key Features:

  • Raw Data Processing: Optional integration with Space Ranger for raw data processing
  • Quality Control: Comprehensive filtering based on total counts, number of expressed genes, and tissue presence
  • Normalization: Advanced normalization methods for spatial data
  • Analysis: Dimensionality reduction, Leiden clustering, and spatial visualization
  • Differential Expression: Testing for differentially expressed genes and spatially varying genes using Moran I score
  • Reproducibility: Containerized workflows using Docker/Singularity for reproducible results

Input Requirements:

  • CSV samplesheet with spatial transcriptomics sample information
  • Minimum UMIs per spot: 500 (configurable via --qc_min_counts)
  • Minimum expressed genes per spot: 250 (configurable via --qc_min_genes)
  • Maximum mitochondrial content: 20% (configurable via --qc_mito_threshold)

Key Parameters:

  • --cluster_resolution: Resolution for spot clustering (default: 1)
  • --cluster_n_hvgs: Number of highly variable genes for analysis (default: 2000)
  • --merge_sdata: Option to merge per-sample SpatialData objects
  • --integrate_sdata: Option to integrate per-sample SpatialData objects

Output:

The pipeline generates comprehensive results including quality control metrics, normalized counts, clustering results, spatial visualizations, differential expression results, and spatially varying gene analysis.

Documentation: https://nf-co.re/spatialvi/dev/

Developed by: Jackson Laboratory, National Bioinformatics Infrastructure Sweden, and National Genomics Infrastructure within SciLifeLab
